dcterms:description: A fundamental problem in computer animation is that of realizing purposeful and realistic human movement given a sufficiently-rich set of motion capture clips. This dataset contains 17 minutes of walking, running, turning, dynamic stopping, and resting motions, captured at 30 Hz and containing about 30,000 frames.
dcterms:title: Motion Capture Database

dcterms:creator: Simon Clavet
dcterms:description: Motion matching works with example motions at the level of individual frames, seeking to choose the best possible next frame from a database of motion capture data when given the previous pose.
dcterms:title: Motion Matching

dcterms:creator: Lucas Kovar
Michael Gleicher
Frédéric Pighin
dcterms:description: Motion graphs infer the connectivity between arbitrary frames on motion clips, allowing the construction of a valid animation from any sequence of these clips without foot skating.
dcterms:title: Motion Graphs

dcterms:creator: Xue Bin Peng
Pieter Abbeel
Sergey Levine
Michiel van de Panne
dcterms:description: DeepMimic is a method for example-guided deep reinforcement learning of physics-based character skills, allowing for the generation of complex character motions.
dcterms:title: DeepMimic

dcterms:creator: Xue Bin Peng
Glen Berseth
Kangkang Yin
Michiel Van De Panne
dcterms:description: DeepLoco is a method for dynamic locomotion skills using hierarchical deep reinforcement learning, enabling characters to learn complex movement patterns.
dcterms:title: DeepLoco

dcterms:creator: Yongjoon Lee
Kevin Wampler
Gilbert Bernstein
Jovan Popović
Zoran Popović
dcterms:description: Motion Fields provide a framework for interactive character locomotion, allowing for real-time control and adaptation of character movements.
dcterms:title: Motion Fields

dcterms:creator: Kevin Bergamin
Simon Clavet
Daniel Holden
James Richard Forbes
dcterms:description: DReCon is a data-driven responsive control framework for physics-based characters, enabling real-time adaptation to dynamic environments.
dcterms:title: DReCon

dcterms:creator: Greg Brockman
Vicki Cheung
Ludwig Pettersson
Jonas Schneider
John Schulman
Jie Tang
Wojciech Zaremba
dcterms:description: OpenAI Gym is a toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms, providing a variety of environments for testing.
dcterms:title: OpenAI Gym

dcterms:creator: Joose Rajamäki
Perttu Hämäläinen
dcterms:description: Hierarchical RL augments sampling-based controllers with machine learning, improving the efficiency and adaptability of control policies.
dcterms:title: Hierarchical RL
